f31ee682-888a-4622-88ad-64f95187d388.description: Resilience in the 21st century includes the capacity to bounce back in the face of stress, challenge, and adversity. They do not dwell on disappointment but rather learn from experience and focus on solutions. Resilient individuals exhibit four core sub-competencies: self-awareness, exhibit flexibility, learn from experience, and focus on solutions.
f31ee682-888a-4622-88ad-64f95187d388.name: Resilience - George Mason University

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has spent 10-15 hours of time on the content, and has demonstrated mastery on the four associated sub-competencies.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their resilience skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has exhibited their resilience skills through a series of performance-based assessments grounded in workplace scenarios.

648b5725-9d73-4f6c-b3fb-94bf016f3dca.description: Earners of the Human Resource Management Certificate badge will have an in-depth understanding of the knowledge, strategies and competencies required for effective HR professionals around the world. They have real-life scenario training, applying concepts, using behavioral judgement, knowledge, and an understanding of best practices for HR today. The SHRM Learning System course will prepare the earner to sit for the SHRM-CP and SHRM-SCP, the only behavioral competency based HR credentials.
648b5725-9d73-4f6c-b3fb-94bf016f3dca.name: Human Resource Management Certificate

alignments.name: SHRM Certification
alignments.description: Apply and earn your SHRM Certification: SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP.

badge_template_activities.title: Based on the SHRM Body of Competency and Knowledge (SHRM BoCK), this course will broaden and update your knowledge and skills through an interactive delivery environment.  You will learn from a SHRM certified instructor who provides expertise, insights and one-on-one guidance.  And you will benefit from a network of peers to help you stay on track with your studies.
Students must adhere to the following attendance policies: 12-Week Classes - Students may not have more than three absences; Online Classes - Students must complete all online assignments.

94e7a233-c196-4c17-962c-8c39f83ec0bd.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the essential skills needed to effectively develop an online course. This includes identifying teaching and learning priorities, adapting course content and activities for an online audience, leveraging Blackboard's features, tools and technologies to support online teaching, organizing course content into an accessible, modular-based structure, creating opportunities for student collaboration and engagement online, and providing feedback on assessments.
94e7a233-c196-4c17-962c-8c39f83ec0bd.name: Online Course Development Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all required activities within the Online Course Development Fundamentals Primer

7d5290a1-50ed-48a8-a119-cf2a34eb30da.description: Resilience in the 21st century includes the capacity to bounce back in the face of stress, challenge, and adversity. Resilient individuals exhibit these four sub-competencies: the capacity to learn from experience; exhibit flexibility; demonstrate self-awareness; and focus on solutions.
7d5290a1-50ed-48a8-a119-cf2a34eb30da.name: Resilience

issuer.summary: issued by George Mason University and authorized by Education Design Lab

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge has spent 10-15 hours of time on the content, and has demonstrated mastery on the four associated sub-competencies.
The recipient of this badge has successfully applied their resilience skills, and the associated sub-competencies in a professional environment.
The recipient of this badge has demonstrated the ability to learn from experience, exhibit flexibility, demonstrate self-awareness, and focus on solutions.

8d5f50c7-6d28-494c-9b43-8fb3b204cda2.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the essential skills needed to effectively develop an online course. This includes identifying teaching and learning priorities for their course; distinguishing between learning opportunities that are especially suited to in-person and/or synchronous learning vs. those that are easily adaptable to virtual and/or asynchronous learning modalities; organizing course content into a modular-based structure that foregrounds learning goals regardless of modality.
8d5f50c7-6d28-494c-9b43-8fb3b204cda2.name: Pivotal Pedagogy

badge_template_activities.title: Complete all required activities within the Pivotal Pedagogy Fundamentals course

7c06e1ab-b1ee-4d77-94ff-6704a0989dda.description: Advanced Technical Writing badge earners possess a wide range of skills required for writing to technical requirements in organizations. These skills include advanced knowledge about writing for a range of audiences, writing for specialized purposes, and editing for professional workplace writing. Badge earners have gained confidence, dexterity, and efficiency in their writing abilities across a wide range of environments and needs.
7c06e1ab-b1ee-4d77-94ff-6704a0989dda.name: CPSE Advanced Technical Writing

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have completed the following six courses: Writing Fundamentals, Plain Language, Oral Presentations, Fundamentals of Grammar and Editing, Principles of Proposal Writing, and Communication in Organizations
CPSE Technical Writing in Organizations
CPSE Foundations of Technical Writing

abe92a22-ad34-4c8d-99c2-23da61d6ad91.description: Earners of the Chief Learning Officer Executive Certificate are uniquely positioned to move into a CLO or similar C-level position or equivalent role in an organization. They can: (1) Develop and manage strategic learning systems; (2) Obtain, direct and manage operational budgets; (3) Develop learning and development strategies for an organization focused on ensuring ROI for such activities; (4) Serve as a key member of the C-Suite setting the organizational strategy.
abe92a22-ad34-4c8d-99c2-23da61d6ad91.name: Chief Learning Officer Executive Program

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete 56 hours of training in-person, with an additional 10 hours, per topic, of outside learning activities and assignments. Training topics include: Design an integrated talent strategy for business objectives; Develop a L&D strategic budget & design strategy for ROI for the organization; Develop a L&D strategy for curriculum delivery; Develop measurement criteria for successful L&D strategies. Project work and 80% attendance is required.

Eligibility requirements include: Application and resume reviewed and approved by the Executive Development Assistant Director which includes demonstrating evidence of receiving an undergraduate degree or equivalent and 4 - 6 years of mid-level management experience.

9ba27b3f-a030-4c79-8c18-b474200abddb.description: Upon completion of this certificate series, individuals will: Possess the knowledge to be compliant with government contracts accounting and auditing requirements; Identify and discuss Federal Acquisition Regulations related to the determination of allowability, allocability, and reasonableness of costs; Identify special report requirement; Determine the current audit environment through an overview of DCAA; and Learn the nature, intent, and requirements of Cost Accounting Standards (CAS).
9ba27b3f-a030-4c79-8c18-b474200abddb.name: Contracting with the Federal Government: Accounting

badge_template_activities.title: CFG 0400 Government Contracting Fundamentals
CFG 0404 The FAR Workshop: Practical Applications & More
CFG 0409 Contract Cost Accounting Deep Dive
CFG 0425 Accounting and Auditing for Government Contracting;
1 required: CFG 0432 Timekeeping for Government Contractors; CFG 0405 Contractor Purchasing System Reviews (CPSR); or CFG 0408 Contract Pricing and Pricing Fundamentals

8c15225b-7844-45b0-ae77-f3d2d4cf0707.description: Earners of the Technical Industry Entrepreneurship Internship Badge have completed a 75-125 hour internship with regional cybersecurity or technical startups during the semester. In addition to working on a range of IT or cyber-related hands-on projects, including cybersecurity, data analytics, or security testing, the students attended a series of four entrepreneurship workshops to introduce them to the world of tech startups and better prepare them to work for these types of companies.
8c15225b-7844-45b0-ae77-f3d2d4cf0707.name: Technical Industry Entrepreneurship Internship

badge_template_activities.title: Application via Handshake
Two homework assignments: Mid-term self-assessment and Final presentation on project and entrepreneurship learning
Four workshops
Individual IT or cyber project, varies by host companies.
Work for tech startup on a real-world project for 75-125 hours

c184eecd-b426-4fd2-b0fa-fb789a60cf95.description: Earners of the Masters Academy in Government Contracting badge have an advanced understanding of contracting with the federal Government. They know the leading practices of contract formation and acquisition planning, contract types, proposal evaluations and source selections, compliance and organizational conflicts of interest, small business contracting and subcontracting, bid protests, changes, claims, disputes, equitable adjustments, terminations and contract closeout.
c184eecd-b426-4fd2-b0fa-fb789a60cf95.name: Masters Academy in Government Contracting

alignments.name: Public Contracting Institute
alignments.description: This course may be eligible for the following credits through The Public Contracting Institute: 27 CLEs or 27 CLPs.

badge_template_activities.title: The Masters Academy provides an exceptional learning experience. Each day, various experts share their insights into the leading practices of government contracting. Over the course of five days and 27 contact hours of instruction, earners have the unique opportunity to learn the lessons experts have culled during their careers in government contracting. The Masters Academy is intended as an advanced course focusing on leading industry practices.
Earners should have at least five years of contracting experience in industry, government, law, or accounting.

97c9cdf6-9987-44b7-9c6a-5b7cc12eda25.description: Earners of the Unmanned Aerial Systems Prototyping badge will have a fundamental understanding of current drone systems and technology. They will understand the various physical components that make up a drone system and how they interact. They will be able to outline and identify the various components and assemble them into a working system. Badge recepients will use these skills to identify a real-world problem, research and prototype a solution, and demonstrate their solution using drones.
97c9cdf6-9987-44b7-9c6a-5b7cc12eda25.name: Unmanned Aerial Systems Prototyping

badge_template_activities.title: Application to join the program- questionnaire regarding participants level of experience, major, and interest
8 sessions, consisting of lecture portion and hands on work session.
As part of a team, participants will research, design, test and present a working prototype
Teams will have to document and pitch their final project to a group of judges

02d8800a-627f-4735-978f-2a6218fa9705.description: This badge is earned when the vast array of rules and regulations governing government contracts are understood, as well as the ability to apply the Federal Acquisition Regulations to a contract. Students will have a strong grasp of negotiation strategies, techniques and skills, and full knowledge of ethical and compliance standards that must be adhered to. They will have obtained the necessary skills to analyze and manage contracts, including the complex area of contract changes.
02d8800a-627f-4735-978f-2a6218fa9705.name: Contracting with the Federal Government: Administration

badge_template_activities.title: CFG 0400 Government Contracting Fundamentals
CFG 0403 Navigating the FAR: Practical Applications
CFG 0451 Negotiation Strategies and Techniques
CFG 0452 Contract Changes and Equitable Adjustments
1 Required: CFG 0407 Government Contract Compliance and Cybersecurity; CFG 0406 Subcontract Management; or CFG 0428 Ethics and Compliance in Government Contracting

68f43e17-0e65-40e8-b5f9-20e960ad06d2.description: Earners of the CEHD Online Course Facilitation badge have the knowledge and skills to establish an online presence, provide support and feedback, facilitate learner-learner discussion and collaboration, and facilitate synchronous sessions. They create videos and an introduction page to establish instructor presence. They design and create a discussion board activity within Blackboard. They also collaboratively create a document describing online collaboration norms.
68f43e17-0e65-40e8-b5f9-20e960ad06d2.name: CEHD Online Course Facilitation

alignments.name: The California State University’s Quality Online Learning and Teaching framework
alignments.description: Section 1: Course Overview and Introduction; Section 2: Assessment of Student Learning; Section 3: Instructional Materials and Resources; Section 4: Student Interaction and Community; Section 5: Facilitation and Instruction

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete a three module course. Each module contains lessons and tasks that are assessed using a rubric. They create videos and an introduction page to establish instructor presence. They design and create a discussion board activity within Blackboard. They also collaboratively create a document describing online collaboration norms.

a5a7b8f2-0d87-412e-9bbd-22973874e2e0.description: Earners of the Chief Data Officer Executive Certificate have enhanced their ability to design and lead the strategy for using data for value creation within their organizations. Upon completion of the program, participants can: (1) understand the value of data assets; (2) develop strategies for use of data to achieve and/or exceed business goals; (3) develop ability to anticipate future technological disruptions; (4) lead change; and (4) facilitate collaboration across the organization.
a5a7b8f2-0d87-412e-9bbd-22973874e2e0.name: Chief Data and Analytics Officer Program

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete 56 hours of training in-person, with an additional 10 hours, per topic, of outside learning activities and assignments. Training topics include: Develop a strategic plan for data activities of the organization; Build a necessary infrastructure to integrate data practices; Create and sustain a data-focused ecosystem; Develop innovation & change activities by leveraging organizational data assets. Project work and 80% attendance is required.

Eligibility requirements include: Application and resume reviewed and approved by the Executive Development Assistant Director which includes demonstrating evidence of receiving an undergraduate degree or equivalent and 4 - 6 years of mid-level management experience.

f104de62-6a2c-45da-a8e9-d44ef9433455.description: Earners of the Humanities Research Scholar badge will understand the significance and relevance of humanities research, the importance of critical thinking to the humanities, and the range of research methodologies employed in the humanities. Earners have cultivated the ability to employ critical thinking and analysis skills to evaluate humanities research, which are necessary to a wide range of professions.
f104de62-6a2c-45da-a8e9-d44ef9433455.name: Humanities Research Scholar

badge_template_activities.title: Earners are undergraduate scholars who are identified through an application and selection process

Earners participate in a 4 session-workshop (1-1.5 hours each). During the workshops, earners learn first hand from scholars what humanities research is and why it matters; how to conceptualize a project; which research methodologies are used in the humanities; the importance of analytical thinking and persuasive writing; and about the applicability of these skills to a range of professions.

70da71a0-5484-4f31-8a7c-a3980cdb021c.description: Earners of the Chief Risk Officer Executive Certificate have the ability to develop, implement and maintain the organizational risk strategy for their organization. Upon completion of the program, participants can: (1) Assess current culture of risk within the organization; (2) Align the risk strategy to specific business objectives; (3) Design an integrated risk strategy; and (4) Evaluate risk management as an opportunity to increase value for the organization.
70da71a0-5484-4f31-8a7c-a3980cdb021c.name: Chief Risk Officer Executive Program

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete 56 hours of training in-person, with an additional 10 hours, per topic, of outside learning activities and assignments. Training topics include: Conduct an internal risk assessment for their organization; Develop a strategic risk management plan; Build processes for threat assessment and recovery; Create scenario analysis in organizational implementation; Develop analytical metrics and strategy for ERM. Project work and 80% attendance is required.

Eligibility requirements include: Application and resume reviewed and approved by the Executive Development Assistant Director which includes demonstrating evidence of receiving an undergraduate degree or equivalent and 4 - 6 years of mid-level management experience.

e9616e59-095e-4bdf-a3df-ca59ade752e4.description: This badge earner has a good understanding of Cloud computing and Virtualization concepts. The individual has knowledge of the Cloud Reference Architecture of NIST, IBM, etc. and can address cloud architecture challenges, use a serverless framework, deploy and test serverless application on a cloud platform, and can explore best practices for designing patterns for architecting optimal IT solutions on cloud.
e9616e59-095e-4bdf-a3df-ca59ade752e4.name: Cloud Computing

badge_template_activities.title: PEVS 310 - Cloud Infrastructure: This course is intended for students who seek an overall understanding of cloud computing, independent of specific technical roles. It provides a detailed overview of cloud concepts, core services, security, architecture, pricing, and support.

PEVS 0311 - Cloud Services Management: This course covers the fundamentals of building IT infrastructure on cloud. The course is designed to teach solutions architects how to optimize their use of the cloud by understanding different services and how they fit into cloud-based solutions.

PEVS 0312 - Application Development in Cloud: This course introduces techniques and best practices for developing applications to take advantage of availability, security, performance, and scalability of the cloud. Students will learn the server-less framework and develop, deploy, and test cloud-based applications using AWS.

PEVS 0313 - Cloud Security Fundamentals: This course is an introduction to cloud security, and covers the fundamentals of building security into cloud platforms, and how to securely manage and access cloud environments using hands-on lab environments. Students will learn how to access cloud environments using IPSec, and utilizing the respective cloud VPN gateways.

PEVS 0314 - Amazon Web Services Cloud Security: This course builds on the concepts from Cloud 105 and focuses on the abilities validated in the AWS Certified Security – Specialty certification. Students will understand specialized data classifications and AWS data protection mechanisms. Data encryption methods and secure Internet protocols will be reviewed along with AWS mechanisms to implement them.
Students must earn at least 75% in each course as a passing score. Students must complete all five courses.

b1eeb2d2-d403-4ad8-a596-312e45c54e93.description: Badge Earners can successfully charter, plan, and execute a project using a traditional or agile project life-cycle development approach and meet all PMI education requirements to sit for the PMI Project Management Professional® examination. They have applied PM principles, theories, and practices to real-world scenarios that require use of best practice models, methods, and artifacts. Emphasis is placed on value delivery, leadership/management principles, tailoring, and change management.
b1eeb2d2-d403-4ad8-a596-312e45c54e93.name: Project Management Certificate

alignments.name: Authorized Training Partner (ATP)
alignments.description: Provider is a member of the PMI ATP Program. ATPs are authorized by PMI to support the professional development needs of future or current PMI practitioners and stakeholders in their pursuit of PMI Credentials. Authorized Training Partners who deliver PMP exam prep have access to licensed PMP exam prep course materials, developed by PMI.

alignments.name: Project Management Institute – PMBOK® Guide and PMI ECO Reference Standards
alignments.description: All courses are aligned to the current version of the Project Management Institute’s (PMI’s) A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK® Guide) and Examination Content Outline (ECO) Reference Standards.

alignments.name: Project Management Institute’s Project Management Professional (PMP)® Credential Examination
alignments.description: The Project Management Certificate Program exceeds PMI’s educational requirements to sit for the PMI PMP credential examination, administered by PMI.

badge_template_activities.title: The Project Management Certificate requires students to complete three courses which consists of 70 contact hours, or 7 Continuing Education Units (CEUs). The topics included are PM Essentials,  Agile Project Management, and PMP® Exam Preparation. The curriculum is designed to lead students through the practices needed to manage a diverse range of project life-cycles. Practical case studies and hands-on exercises reinforce tools and techniques that are taught.
Students must successfully pass all end of course assessments demonstrating proficiency in course outcomes.

bad06a74-6d25-45c2-b956-81c8e27616ae.description: Earners of the Chief Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Executive Certificate are uniquely positioned to move into CDEIO or similar C-level positions or equivalent role in an organization. They can: (1) Develop the strategic plan for DEI efforts; (2) Obtain, direct and manage operational budgets of DEI efforts; (3) Serve as a key member of the C-Suite setting the organizational strategy.
bad06a74-6d25-45c2-b956-81c8e27616ae.name: Chief Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Officer Executive Program

alignments.name: School of Business Executive Certificate
alignments.description: The programs are currently delivered as a non-degree, School of Business executive certificate. By adding the opportunity for attendees to add a badge credential for successful completion of the program to their resume for organizational recognition (internal and external) and to indicate the accomplishment of obtaining a GMU credential.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 56 hours of training in-person, with an additional 10 hours, per topic of outside learning assignments.
Degree or equivalent work experience and 4-6 years in mid-level management experience
4-5 years in mid-level management

9da2fdbf-7203-49ca-a71a-30dd891db3ef.description: Earners of the CCI Cybersecurity Traineeship badge have an understanding of cybersecurity fundamentals and have demonstrated the ability to complete tasks of a junior-level cybersecurity professional. They are familiar with a battery of topics integral to the field of cybersecurity and can apply this knowledge in real-world applications. These candidates are trained to a level at which they are ready to pursue junior-level careers in cybersecurity.
9da2fdbf-7203-49ca-a71a-30dd891db3ef.name: CCI Cybersecurity Fundamentals Traineeship

badge_template_activities.title: Competitive application process
Regular tests and quizzes to ensure learning outcomes
The equivalent of three courses covering technical skills relevant to cybersecurity
Completion of the 7-week coursework experience

9e83ce2a-8aab-4c2c-a283-4b592ec88bf7.description: Earners of the Document Accessibility Fundamentals credential will have a foundational understanding of how to create accessible documents (Word, PowerPoint, and PDF) using Microsoft 365 and Acrobat Pro DC. This includes, for example, adding alt text for images, styles for document structure, and using effective color contrast. They have also demonstrated how to identify and fix document accessibility-related issues using built-in and 3rd-party accessibility checkers.
9e83ce2a-8aab-4c2c-a283-4b592ec88bf7.name: Document Accessibility Fundamentals

alignments.name: GMU University Policy 1308, Section 508/WCAG Standards
alignments.description: This policy applies to all information and communications technology (ICT) resources and services produced, maintained, distributed, and/or purchased by George Mason University for use by Mason students, staff, faculty, and visitors, including those with disabilities.

badge_template_activities.title: Word, PPT, and PDF Remediation Module Exams
Document Accessibility Fundamentals Course (web-based, self-paced)
Participation in ATI Cohort Orientation, at least 2 ATI Supplemental Drop-In sessions, and ATI Cohort Closing Session

70d04e7f-dd84-4dbd-ae7d-080c51486aef.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated fundamental knowledge, skills, and abilities in data analysis, data visualization, and data security. Earners have completed curriculum that aligns with the employer-validated, digital tech competencies required for jobs with Capital CoLAB employers.
70d04e7f-dd84-4dbd-ae7d-080c51486aef.name: Generalist Digital Technology Credential

badge_template_activities.title: STAT 250 Introduction to Statistics:  Elementary introduction to statistics. Topics include descriptive statistics, probability, and estimation and hypothesis testing for means and proportions. Statistical software used for assignments.

STAT 350 Introduction to Statistics II: Further examination of statistics and data analysis with an emphasis on applications. Inference for comparing multiple samples, experimental design, analysis of variance and post-hoc tests. Simple linear, multiple and logistic regression. Analysis of contingency tables and categorical data. A statistical computer package is used for data analysis.

CDS 301 Scientific Information and Data Visualization: The techniques and software used to visualize scientific simulations, complex information, and data visualization for knowledge discovery. Includes examples and exercises to help students develop their understanding of the role visualization plays in computational science and provides a foundation for applications in their careers.

STAT 463 Introduction to Exploratory Data Analysis: Features statistical graphics, maps and simple models used to bring out patterns in data. Introduces statistical software and addresses data access and import. Presents exploratory strategies motivating data transformations. Stresses the cognitive foundations of good graphics. Graphics include dot plots, box plots, Q-Q plots, parallel coordinate plots, scatterplot matrices and linked views. Exploration includes use of dynamic graphics.

CYSE 101 Introduction to Cyber Security Engineering: Provides comprehensive introduction to the principles, applications, and practice of cyber security engineering. Students learn the basic concepts and terminology of cyber security and how cyber security is commonly addressed after the design and implementation phases. Students are introduced to the systems engineering and design processes and learn to integrate and apply cyber security tools and techniques in these processes
Quantitative Elective from Data Analysis Minor

d6303ceb-ef98-48ba-880b-5a01a2aa200e.description: Individuals who earn the Trusted Tester for Web Fundamentals have a foundational understanding of the legal standards outlined in Section 508 of the Rehab Act of 1973 and the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.x Level A and AA , as well as the basic elements of accessible web design. Earners have demonstrated the ability to independently identify and report issues related to inaccessible web content (e.g., structure, color contrast, forms, alternative text descriptions for images, etc.).
d6303ceb-ef98-48ba-880b-5a01a2aa200e.name: Trusted Tester for Web Fundamentals

alignments.name: GMU University Policy 1308
alignments.description: This policy applies to all information and communications technology (ICT) resources and services produced, maintained, distributed, and/or purchased by George Mason University for use by Mason students, staff, faculty, and visitors, including those with disabilities.

badge_template_activities.title: Department of Homeland Security's Trusted Tester for Web on Windows Incremental Practical Exams
Department of Homeland Security's Trusted Tester for Web on Windows Course
Participation in ATI Cohort Orientation, at least 2 ATI Supplemental Drop-In sessions, and ATI Cohort Closing Session

8539e554-9257-4dea-bfb2-4a59f7d0998b.description: Earners of the CEHD Online Course Design badge have the foundational knowledge and skills to develop online content pages and assessments. They understand online learning principles, modalities, and learning interactions. Within the Learning Management System Blackboard, they create (1) a screencast video, (2) a content with accessible media (e.g., image, document, and video), (3) a performance-based assessment and rubric, and (4) an objectively scored quiz with automated feedback.
8539e554-9257-4dea-bfb2-4a59f7d0998b.name: CEHD Online Course Design

alignments.name: The California State University’s Quality Online Learning and Teaching framework
alignments.description: Section 1: Course Overview and Introduction; Section 2: Assessment of Student Learning; Section 3: Instructional Materials and Resources; Section 4: Student Interaction and Community; Section 5: Facilitation and Instruction

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete a three module course. Each module contains lessons and tasks that are assessed using a rubric. Participants create (1) a screencast video, (2) a content with accessible media (e.g., image, document, and video), (3) a performance-based assessment and rubric, and (4) an objectively scored quiz with automated feedback.

9ac92f67-9fe8-4ce4-9fa4-d1b10ae336aa.description: Earners of the professional certificate can successfully extract the most potential out of data sets and apply those insights for key business decisions, no matter the industry or seniority level. They have applied and leveraged programming fundamentals, data wrangling techniques, visualizations, and machine learning models to create solutions to real-world problems that require the ability to think analytically. Earners will be prepared for the job with effective and impactful data skills.
9ac92f67-9fe8-4ce4-9fa4-d1b10ae336aa.name: Data Analytics

badge_template_activities.title: Data Analytics Badge requires learners to complete three courses, consisting of 104 hours, or 10.4 CEUs. Programming for Data Science: covers programming fundamentals (setting up a Data Science environment, Python, SQL, Pandas).
Course 2: Data Wrangling, Visualization, and Reporting: explores and applies current concepts and tools for data analytics.
Course 3: Machine Learning: evaluates and implements Machine Learning methods and models to defined problems. Courses must be taken sequentially.
100% attendance and successful completion of all assessments is required.

skills.name: Programming with Python for Data Science

70fcc79d-2a1f-4b4e-b029-108685dd676e.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate a critical awareness of language-related health disparities in U.S. Spanish-speaking communities. Badge earners are able to analyze the roles and ethics of interpretation in medical and social service settings and determine best practices in virtual telehealth settings. Badge earners display advanced autonomous learning skills and critical language awareness.
70fcc79d-2a1f-4b4e-b029-108685dd676e.name: Advanced Applications of Spanish for Healthcare and Social Services

badge_template_activities.title: Basic Language Requirement equivalent (12 credits at 100- and 200- level).

Completion of Think Cultural Health course created by the Office of Minority Health (U.S. Department of Health and Human Services): “Promoviendo Decisiones Saludables y Cambios en la Comunidad: Un Curso de Aprendizaje en Línea para Promotores de Salud”. Students should complete this 4-module course in Spanish and upload the certificate of completion to the central micro-credential site on Blackboard.
Complete online learning module in the central micro-credential site on Blackboard (Areas 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5).

Select two courses: One relevant 400- or 500-level course in Spanish or Foreign Language. One relevant 400- or 500-level course in Anthropology, Community Health, Global Health, Nursing, Public Health, Social Work, Sociology, or a related field.

Choose and complete two out of the following three areas: 1) Study abroad, language brokering or any other immersion experience. 2) Internship, practicum or other professional training experience in a healthcare or social service setting. 3) Completion of senior capstone projects, honors theses, or community-based learning projects on a relevant topic.
Complete an Exit Reflection and upload to the central micro-credential site on Blackboard.

skills.name: Spanish For Medical And Social Services Settings

06e7c593-43cd-4d37-a5e2-21a994911677.description: The Advanced Network IT Certification allows you to take two courses that prepare you for the CompTIA’s A+, Network+ and Security+ and Cisco® Certified Networking Associate (CCNA) certifications 100% online. The Computing Technology Industry Association (CompTIA) is considered the world's leading technology association. Since its founding in 1982, CompTIA has set standards for certification in IT support, from hardware and devices to networks and cybersecurity.
06e7c593-43cd-4d37-a5e2-21a994911677.name: Advanced Network IT Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: EDGO 0398 Advanced Network IT Certificate

dd2ce88c-63b2-4df5-97e7-37b0e4fb1275.description: Earners of this badge are able to recognize and analyze sociolinguistic variation in the use of Spanish in medical and social service settings. Badge earners further develop the ability to utilize sociolinguistic, intercultural, and pragmatic knowledge and skills in order to successfully communicate in interprofessional contexts. Badge earners implement autonomous learning skills and engage in critical reflection.
dd2ce88c-63b2-4df5-97e7-37b0e4fb1275.name: Building Knowledge and Skills in Spanish for Healthcare and Social Services

badge_template_activities.title: Basic Language Requirement equivalent (12 credits at 100- and 200- level).

Completion of Think Cultural Health course created by the Office of Minority Health (U.S. Department of Health and Human Services): “Promoviendo Decisiones Saludables y Cambios en la Comunidad: Un Curso de Aprendizaje en Línea para Promotores de Salud”. Students should complete this 4-module course in Spanish or English (Spanish highly encouraged) and upload the certificate of completion to the central micro-credential site on Blackboard.
Complete online learning module in the central micro-credential site on Blackboard (Areas 1, 2 & 3).

Select two courses: One relevant 300- or 400-level course in Spanish or Foreign Language. One relevant 300- or 400-level course in Anthropology, Community Health, Global Health, Nursing, Public Health, Social Work, Sociology, or a related field.

Choose and complete one out of the following three areas: 1) Study abroad, language brokering or any other immersion experience. 2) Internship, practicum or other professional training experience in a healthcare or social service setting. 3) Completion of senior capstone projects, honors theses, or community-based learning projects on a relevant topic.
Complete an Exit Reflection and upload to the central micro-credential site on Blackboard.

skills.name: Spanish For Medical And Social Services Settings

492e7f06-1a44-4af1-b505-1a84020cd039.description: Participants who complete the BPM Bootcamp will be able to: • Use a systems thinking approach to solving business problems • Utilize basic process mapping techniques to understand and analyze workflow • Identify opportunities to eliminate non-value-added costs and reduce cycle time • Generate ideas to consistently deliver higher customer satisfaction • Use basic project and change management techniques to deploy solutions • Manage cross functional processes to sustain operational excellence
492e7f06-1a44-4af1-b505-1a84020cd039.name: Business Process Management

badge_template_activities.title: 30 hours (live)
Individual and group exercises
Test

dff04340-7799-4c0d-8e51-0cd957a7d477.description: Earners of the Chief Marketing Officer Executive Certificate are uniquely positioned to move into the CMO or similar executive level of C-Suite positions in an organization. They can: (1) Develop the strategic plan for marketing efforts; (2) Obtain, direct, and manage operational budges for marketing functions; (3) Serve as a key member of the C-Suite and executive leadership teams in setting organizational strategy.
dff04340-7799-4c0d-8e51-0cd957a7d477.name: Chief Marketing Officer Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 40 hours of in-person training, with an additional 10 hour, per topic (6) for online and outside learning assignments
UG degree or equivalent work experience and 4-6 years of mid-level management experience.
4-5 years in mid-level management
One-time registration required to attend program and all events

d1ff8740-db8b-4fd4-b815-ab1dc0b2d826.description: Earners of the Chief Sustainability Officer Program Executive Certificate are uniquely positioned to move in the CSO or similar executive level of c-suite positions in the organization. They can: (1) Develop the strategic plan for organizational sustainability efforts; (2) obtain, direct, and manage operational budgets for sustainability functions; and (3) serve as a key member of the c-suite and executive leadership teams in setting organizational strategy.
d1ff8740-db8b-4fd4-b815-ab1dc0b2d826.name: Chief Sustainability Officer Program

alignments.name: Chief Sustainability Officer program
alignments.description: The Chief Sustainability Officer program is a non-degree School of Business Executive Development certificate program providing the opportunity to earn a badge credential for successfully completing the program to their resume for organizational recognition and to indicate the accomplishment of obtaining a George Mason University credential.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 40 hours of in-person training with an additional 10 hours per 6 online asynchronous and synchronous learning
Undergrad degree or equivalent work experience and 4-6 years of mid- to upper-level management experience.
4-6 years of mid- to upper-level management
One time registration required to attend program and all related events.

d9ed0a08-868a-4563-82b7-df3157506dc0.description: Earners of the Digital Badge have a fundamental understanding of the FAR and how to interpret it when executing business transactions. Their increased professional knowledge of the acquisition system improves their ability to operate successfully and allows them to mentor others on using the FAR. The student's familiarity of the FAR keeps them informed on FAR-centered contracting issues and application of FAR principles.
d9ed0a08-868a-4563-82b7-df3157506dc0.name: Contracting with the Federal Government: Essentials

alignments.name: The FAR Workshop: Practical Applications & More
Public Contracting Institute
alignments.description: This course may be eligible for the CLE and CLP credits through The Public Contracting Institute

badge_template_activities.title: CFG 0400 Government Contracting Fundamentals
CFG 0404 The FAR Workshop: Practical Applications & More

b4ad3006-ae17-48ce-9fee-9056aa41b005.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated in depth knowledge, skills, and abilities in system and network security, privacy, and the ethical and legal considerations in ensuring the security of digital technology. Earners have completed curriculum that aligns with the employer-validated, digital tech competencies required for jobs with Capital CoLAB employers.
b4ad3006-ae17-48ce-9fee-9056aa41b005.name: Data Analytics Digital Technology Credential

alignments.name: Capital CoLAB Data Analytics Specialist Credential

badge_template_activities.title: Undergraduate students pursuing degrees in statistics, computing, information technology, data science, etc have demonstrated competency in data analytics through coursework focused on data storage and management. Earners have completed a minimum of 15 academic credits or 675 contact hours of courses aligned with the knowledge, skills, and abilities identified in collaboration with the Capital CoLab employers.
Earners must receive a final course grade of C or better in all required coursework.

6490d715-997b-423d-8b58-a0bc42f34eb6.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate a basic understanding of the relationship between language access, health, and social equity for language-minority populations, particularly U.S. Spanish-speakers. They develop knowledge of specialized vocabulary in Spanish within medical and social service settings and demonstrate a capacity for autonomous learning and self-reflection.
6490d715-997b-423d-8b58-a0bc42f34eb6.name: Foundations of Spanish for Healthcare and Social Services

badge_template_activities.title: Equivalent of 9 credits in Spanish courses at 100- and 200- level.

Completion of Think Cultural Health course created by the Office of Minority Health (U.S. Department of Health and Human Services): “Promoviendo Decisiones Saludables y Cambios en la Comunidad: Un Curso de Aprendizaje en Línea para Promotores de Salud”. Students should complete this 4-module course in Spanish or English and upload the certificate of completion to the central micro-credential site on Blackboard.

Select two courses: One relevant 200-level course in Spanish or Foreign Language. One relevant 200-level course in Anthropology, Community Health, Global Health, Nursing, Public Health, Social Work, Sociology, or a related field.
Complete online learning module in the central micro-credential site on Blackboard (Area 1)
Complete an Exit Reflection and upload to the central micro-credential site on Blackboard.

3a86c4c2-dfd9-4c0e-bb58-1a967bb41991.description: This course bundle allows you to earn your Information Security Certification by taking essential courses Security+, CASP, CISA, CISSP, to expand your information security skills through certifications—100% online. This course bundle will provide you with a comprehensive understanding of IT security fundamentals. Each course is designed to provide the information needed to pass your exams and enhance your skills to enable future career success in the field of security.
3a86c4c2-dfd9-4c0e-bb58-1a967bb41991.name: Information Security Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: EDGO 0399 - Information Security Certificate

ad3e11cc-9111-4eb9-99a1-5ea05f1d7d78.description: This course will prepare you for three CompTIA IT certifications that are ideal for entry-level and mid-level professionals: A+, Network+ and Security+. The CompTIA certifications are the most-recognized, vendor-neutral credentials in the industry, and will assure employers that you have the skills they need.
ad3e11cc-9111-4eb9-99a1-5ea05f1d7d78.name: Network IT Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: EDGO 0377 - Network IT Certificate

455ec4ff-366e-4df9-a869-4dbd9530c2c8.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated comprehensive knowledge of the American judicial system and practical skills to assist trial attorneys including interviewing witnesses, investigating complex fact patterns, researching the law, and assisting in preparing cases for courtroom litigation. They also know how to locate and use legal authority in the litigation process, the basics of law office management, legal document preparation, and the role the paralegal plays in the law office.
455ec4ff-366e-4df9-a869-4dbd9530c2c8.name: Paralegal Certificate Course

badge_template_activities.title: Complete readings and discussions in 12 modules. Topics include the American legal system, legal process, rules of civil procedure, ethics, torts, contracts, legal document preparation, legal analysis, discovery, legal interviewing, evidence, legal investigation, authority, citation format, appellate procedure, legal writing, drafting legal memoranda, and law office administration.
Apply knowledge and demonstrate paralegal skills through a series of exams and written assignments obtaining a 70% or higher on all assessments.

skills.name: Application Of Federal Rules Of Civil Procedure
